data

Class MinHeap

  • java.lang.Object
    • data.MinHeap

  • public class MinHeap
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a minimum binary heap which replaces the priority queue used in certain pathfinding algorithms

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MinHeap(int size)
      Constructs a new array to contain the vertices in the heap

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decreaseKey(int index, int newKey)
      Decreases the key of a node and rearranges the heap accordingly.
      HeapNode deleteMin()
      Deletes and returns the root of the heap which contains the node with the minimum key value and then rearranges the heap.
      HeapNode[] getArray() 
      int getLength() 
      void insert(HeapNode node)
      Inserts a new node in the heap as long as the heap array can fit it
      int left(int index)
      Returns the index of the left child node.
      int parent(int index)
      Returns the index of the parent node.
      int right(int index)
      Returns the index of the right child node.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MinHeap

        public MinHeap(int size)
        Constructs a new array to contain the vertices in the heap
        Parameters:
        size - The maximum size of the heap (the amount of vertices in the graph)

    • Method Detail

      • parent

        public int parent(int index)
        Returns the index of the parent node. Because index is an integer, the division gets floored automatically.
        Parameters:
        index - of a node in the heap
        Returns:
        the index of the parent node

      • left

        public int left(int index)
        Returns the index of the left child node.
        Parameters:
        index - of a node in the heap
        Returns:
        the index of the left child node

      • right

        public int right(int index)
        Returns the index of the right child node.
        Parameters:
        index - of a node in the heap
        Returns:
        the index of the right child node

      • insert

        public void insert(HeapNode node)
        Inserts a new node in the heap as long as the heap array can fit it
        Parameters:
        node - new node to be inserted

      • decreaseKey

        public void decreaseKey(int index,
                        int newKey)
        Decreases the key of a node and rearranges the heap accordingly.
        Parameters:
        index - index of the node to change the key of
        newKey - new key value for the node

      • deleteMin

        public HeapNode deleteMin()
        Deletes and returns the root of the heap which contains the node with the minimum key value and then rearranges the heap.
        Returns:
        the node with the minimum key value

        public int getLength()

      • getArray

        public HeapNode[] getArray()
